text:
Deborah L. Rhode (January 29, 1952 – January 8, 2021) was an American jurist. She was the Ernest W. McFarland Professor of Law at Stanford Law School. She created the term "The "No-Problem" Problem". She wrote over 250 articles and 30 books, including "Women and Leadership", "Lawyers as Leaders", and "The Beauty Bias". Rhode was born in Evanston, Illinois.
Rhode died at her home on January 8, 2021 in Stanford, California at the age of 68.
